comments.author: Syed F Akbar
comments.content:
Nice, very nice. Very well written.

In a land bereft of opportunity (for the common man), people tend to seize on every chance to gain a coin ... and control.

Yes, control. Tired of bending and bowing, the little people relish the opportunity to say "This is my house, and these are my rules".

Now, if you would have indicated a desire to make a 'nazrana' of a thousand rupees at the maz'ar of the baba, the rules would have been relaxed, the veil would have lifted, to allow you access. You could also have achieved the same relaxation of rules by donning a military officer's uniform.

It is akin to a writer, a good writer, withholding the location of both of the two places he (or she) so deliciously describes. 

It says  "This is my blog, and it is my choice" 

It asks  "Do you have a nazrana ?"

Oh' ignore my rant, please. Will you ?   I am just a senile old man writing from the other side of the globe, too frail to visit any of these wonderful places I read about.  You go ahead and write, for you have a gift. Write with an open heart ... throw it all up in the air. Let the chips fall where ever they may.

Yes, I enjoyed reading your article/blog. Thank you.

Fazal
